name: access_website
description:
Opens the requested url in a browser.

Do not use it unless the user prompt contains a url or explicitly asks to open a website.

target_url.description:
The URL to open.
Do not include the protocol (e.g. https://) if the user prompt does not include it.

name_of_website.description: The name of the website to open. Do not include the top-level domain.

name: activate_camera
description:
Opens the device's camera.

This method allows specifying which camera to use (e.g., front or rear)
and the initial mode it should open in (e.g., photo or video mode).

camera_to_use.description: The type of camera to open. Can be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR' or 'DEFAULT'.

initial_function.description: The initial functional mode for the camera upon opening. Can be one of 'PHOTO' or 'VIDEO'.

name: capture_current_screen
description: Takes a screenshot on the device.

name: capture_video
description:
Records a video using the device camera.

If the user requests to record a video with a delay, ignore the delay and start recording immediately.

recording_camera_type.description: The type of camera to use. Can be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR' or 'DEFAULT'.

desired_video_length.description: Duration of the video recording, for example "record a 15 second video".

name: disable_torch
description: Turns off the flashlight on the device. Nox can be used to turn off the flashlight.

name: enable_torch
description: Turns on the flashlight on the device. Lumos can be used to turn on the flashlight.

name: find_my_phone
description: Sends an action to the device requesting it to remotely ring the user's paired phone.

name: initiate_reboot_sequence
description: Restarts the device. It can only open the power options menu.

name: launch_application
description:
Opens the requested application on the device.

Alternative app names:
 - If the user wants to open "alarms" or "timers" but there is no app with an
   obviously matching name, open any clock app, if present, as a less-preferred fallback.

application_to_start.description:
The name of the application to open.
This name has to exactly match one of the names produced by `get_installed_apps`.

package_identifier.description: The package name of the application to open.

intent_extras.description:
The extras in json string format to send to the application being opened.
Note:
* This should only be populated when opening "Pixel Screenshots".
* When opening "Pixel Screenshots", always extract the information-seeking part of the user prompt and populate it in the extras field.
* The key of the extras field is "query". The value of the extras field is the query extracted from the user prompt.
* The query should be a full question/sentence, unless the original user prompt is too terse to infer one.

name: list_installed_applications
description: Gets the list of installed application on the device.

name: navigate_to_device_home
description: Navigates to home screen on the device.

name: search_the_web
description: Opens a Google search page with the provided query in the browser (e.g. Chrome).

name: show_power_down_menu
description: Powers off the device. It can only open the power options menu.

name: snap_picture
description: Takes a photo using the device camera.

selected_camera.description: The type of camera to open. Can be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR' or 'DEFAULT'. When the user asks to take a selfie, use the value FRONT.

photo_timer_delay.description: Delay time to start taking a photo. If the user does not specify the delay time, always provide a default value '3 seconds'.

picture_style.description: The mode the camera should use when taking a picture. Can be one of 'DEFAULT' or 'PORTRAIT'.
